title: Understanding Dissociative Identity Disorder
text: Dissociative Identity Disorder (DID) is a complex psychological condition. It involves a person experiencing two or more distinct identities or personality states.

title: Characteristics of DID
text: Each identity in DID may have its own name, age, history, and characteristics. These identities may take control of the person's behavior at different times.

hintAnswer: The presence of two or more distinct personality states, with a disconnection in the individual’s sense of self and actions
title: Identifying the Correct Definition
text: Which of the following best describes Dissociative Identity Disorder?
choices: a type of insecure attachment characterized by a need for closeness and intimacy but with a persistent fear of rejection or abandonment
a type of insecure attachment characterized by inconsistent or unpredictable behavior in caregivers, leading to confusion and fear in children
a type of insecure attachment characterized by a need for independence and discomfort with intimacy and closeness
The presence of two or more distinct personality states, with a disconnection in the individual’s sense of self and actions
